entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 7:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, the Haines Highway, northwest of Haines. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. At

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:20PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Holiday Weekend... * A cold front will bring temperatures down to 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. Highs in the lower to mid 80s are expected in the lower elevations, with upper 60s to lower 70s in Sierra valleys. For many areas this could be the coolest July 4th since 2000. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:28AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: Patchy dense fog has developed across counties in the South Carolina Upstate, resulting in intermittent decreases in visibility to 2 miles or less. Fog may develop quickly, especially in exposed locations. Exercise extreme caution when driving in low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:54PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...REDUCED VISIBILITY FROM FOG AND SMOKE SATURDAY MORNING... The combination of smoke from area fires and patchy fog may lead to reductions in visibility to 1 mile or less at times late tonight through Saturday morning. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 01 at 1:50PM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the West Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. The winds and low humidity will allow for critical fire weather conditions to develop Saturday and Sunday for portions of central and eastern Nevada. Little to no rain is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Elko County; Northern Nye County - Mojave; White Pine and Northeast Nye Counties

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:37AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Very warm and dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An approaching upper level system will bring gusty south to southwest winds Saturday and especially Sunday. The winds in combination with the warm and dry weather will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON COUNTY... At 259 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Santee Coastal Reserve, or 7 miles east of McClellanville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:28AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: Patchy dense fog has developed across counties in the South Carolina Upstate, resulting in intermittent decreases in visibility to 2 miles or less. Fog may develop quickly, especially in exposed locations. Exercise extreme caution when driving in low visibility.
